1.2.12-128-M.asw_1: - on the left and right-hand hard shoulders
1.2.12-128-M.asw_2: - on the left-hand hard shoulder only
1.2.12-128-M.asw_3: - on the right-hand hard shoulder only
1.2.12-128-M.info: The entire roadway is a one-way street and is thus only valid for one direction. This allows parking in the direction of travel on both the left-hand shoulder and right-hand shoulder.

1.2.34-113.asw_1: - stop and determine the consequences of the accident
1.2.34-113.asw_2: - secure the scene of the accident
1.2.34-113.asw_3: - provide aid if anyone has been injured
1.2.34-113.info: Those involved in the accident must stop and ascertain the consequences of the accident. The accident site must then be secured. Only then can help be provided if anyone is injured.
1.2.34-113.text: What are you obliged to do, if you are involved in a road traffic accident?

1.2.36-011.asw_2: - stop if the police vehicle stops
1.2.36-011.asw_3: - allow the engine to continue running once I have stopped
1.2.36-011.info: The instructions of the police apply to the vehicle immediately following it. So it is necessary to stay behind the police car and follow it. If the police car stops, your vehicle must also stop.
1.2.36-011.text: You are overtaken by a police vehicle, which pulls in immediately in front of you. The words "BITTE FOLGEN" (PLEASE FOLLOW) appear illuminated in red on the roof. What should you do?

1.2.36-012.asw_2: To all vehicles in my lane
1.2.36-012.asw_3: For police and rescue vehicles following behind
1.2.36-012.info: Such an instruction given by the police applies to the immediately following vehicle.
1.2.36-012.text: You are overtaken by a police vehicle, which pulls in immediately in front of you. The words "BITTE FOLGEN" (PLEASE FOLLOW) appear illuminated in red on the roof. To whom does this apply?

1.2.36-013.asw_1: I have to follow the vehicle until it stops
1.2.36-013.asw_2: I may not overtake the vehicle
1.2.36-013.asw_3: I have to turn in the direction indicated
1.2.36-013.info: Police officers may stop motorists for traffic checks, including roadworthiness checks, and for road surveys. A police officer may also give a sign to stop by means of appropriate technical equipment on the emergency vehicle, an indicator signalling disc or a red light. Therefore, it is necessary to follow the vehicle until it stops. Since it is necessary to follow, overtaking is not permitted.
1.2.36-013.text: A police signalling disc is displayed towards you from a vehicle driving in front of you. What does this mean?

1.2.37-018.asw_1: I allow any cross traffic the right of way
1.2.37-018.asw_2: I wait at the stop line for the next set of green lights
1.2.37-018.asw_3: I drive through the junction quickly, because "yellow" is displayed
1.2.37-018.info: The light is out of order. Therefore, the traffic signs that grant the right of way to cross traffic are valid. Priority must thus be given to cross-traffic.
1.2.37-018.text: What is the right course of action now?

1.4.42-141.asw_1: I am on a priority road that bends left
1.4.42-141.asw_2: I am not permitted to turn right or drive straight ahead
1.4.42-141.asw_3: If I continue driving straight ahead, I have to allow right of way to vehicles arriving from the right
1.4.42-141.info: The combination of traffic signs points to a priority road that bends to the left.
1.4.42-141.text: What does this traffic sign combination mean to you?

1.1.01-003.asw_1: I respond as soon as possible to probable changes in the road traffic situation
1.1.01-003.asw_2: I attempt to identify the intentions of other road users, as soon as possible
1.1.01-003.asw_3: I limit my observation of road traffic as much as possible on the vehicle travelling directly in front of me
1.1.01-003.info: Among other things, anticipatory driving aims to identify the intentions of other road users as early as possible. This makes it possible to react to changes in the traffic situation in a timely manner.
1.1.01-003.text: Which of these is a good example of "anticipatory driving"?

1.1.07-152-M.info: There is a motorcyclist to the left of your vehicle. It is important to keep an eye on him. Additionally, you have to pay attention to the pedestrian because he will still be on the road when the traffic lights change.
1.1.07-152-M.text: What must you look out for when the traffic lights turn green?

1.2.02-109.info: The traffic sign "Crossing or junction with priority to vehicles on the right" regulates the right of way. The rule "right before left" applies.
1.2.02-109.text: What is correct in this situation?

1.2.02-110.asw_1: - the width of the priority road
1.2.02-110.asw_2: - the speed and the distance of the cross traffic
1.2.02-110.info: Obstruction of cross traffic must be avoided, which is why weather conditions (fog, rain, snowfall, etc.) must be taken into account. The width of the roadway must be taken into account, because the wider it is or the more lanes there are, the more time is needed to cross it. The speed and distance of cross traffic must be taken into account in order to cross the road safely.
1.2.02-110.text: What do you have to watch out for, when crossing a priority road?

1.2.09-129.asw_2: - give the car right of way
1.2.09-129.info: It is necessary to brake because it is not yet clear whether the blue car is leaving the roundabout or continuing its journey. Since the blue car is already at the roundabout, it has the right of way. If he does not leave the roundabout, he must be given right of way.
1.2.09-129.text: What must you be aware of here?

1.2.10-109.asw_1: I may not endanger the moving traffic
1.2.10-109.asw_2: I have to indicate before moving off
1.2.10-109.asw_3: I have to take note of the traffic behind me
1.2.10-109.info: Leaving the gap must be indicated by indicating. Rear traffic must be observed in order to avoid endangering other users of the road. The same applies to flowing traffic, which must not be endangered.
1.2.10-109.text: You want to exit a parking space and move into the moving traffic. What should you do?

1.2.12-121-M.info: Limit markings indicate, extend or shorten a stop or parking prohibition indicated elsewhere. The white car extends beyond the marking and is parked incorrectly.

1.2.20-106.asw_1: I use clear hand signals to forego my right of way
1.2.20-106.asw_2: I am the first to drive to the centre of the junction, where I stop
1.2.20-106.asw_3: I am the first to pass through the junction
1.2.20-106.info: At crossroads and junctions, priority is given to those coming from the right. In this situation, all vehicles are immediately forced to give way. To resolve the situation, a driver must give way. For this purpose, it is recommended to do without your own right of way and to signal that you have given way with a clear hand signal.
1.2.20-106.text: All vehicles have been waiting at the junction for a few seconds. What should you do in this situation?

1.3.01-125-M.asw_1: I have to allow right of way to the red car
1.3.01-125-M.asw_2: I have right of way ahead of the blue car
1.3.01-125-M.asw_3: I have to allow right of way to the blue car
1.3.01-125-M.info: At this intersection, traffic signs do not regulate the right of way. Those coming from the right have right of way. It is thus necessary to give priority to the red car. The blue car must give you priority.
1.3.01-125-M.text: What is the right course of action?

1.3.01-126-M.asw_2: I have to allow the yellow car to pass through
1.3.01-126-M.info: The traffic sign "Right of way at the next intersection or junction" regulates the right of way. Even if you turn left, you have right of way and the yellow car must wait for you.

1.4.41-158.info: Traffic sign 1 ends the right of way. It requires motorists to "grant the right of way".
1.4.41-158.text: You are driving along a priority road. Which traffic sign ends your right of way?

1.4.42-142.asw_1: Children may play across the entire road
1.4.42-142.asw_2: Motor vehicles have to drive at walking speed
1.4.42-142.asw_3: Pedestrians are entitled to use the entire breadth of the road
1.4.42-142.info: The traffic sign indicates a traffic-calmed area. Children are allowed to play all over the street there. Pedestrians may use the entire width of the road. Motor vehicles must drive at a walking speed.
1.4.42-142.text: What do you have to be aware of when you see this traffic sign?

1.1.02-050-M.asw_1: Because the traffic situation is confusing
1.1.02-050-M.asw_2: Because there is a child on the carriageway
1.1.02-050-M.asw_3: Because the white van is moving off
1.1.02-050-M.info:
It is important to drive slowly and be ready to brake, because a child has run onto the road behind the white transporter and could cross the road.

In addition, the traffic situation is confusing because the petrol station is causing a queue of vehicles reaching onto the road.
1.1.02-050-M.text: Why must you drive slowly here and be ready to brake?

1.1.07-153-M.asw_2: That the truck driver will jump down onto the carriageway
1.1.07-153-M.asw_3: That traffic signs are concealed behind the truck

Strong exhaust smoke indicates a defective exhaust system that releases pollutants unnecessarily. Repair is required. The engine is not required for longer waiting periods; it should be switched off in this case.

Unnecessary driving back and forth unnecessarily pollutes the environment.

Unnecessarily fast acceleration is a noise nuisance that should be avoided. Damaged mufflers also generate unnecessary noise.

Driving fast in low gears means high engine speed and thus avoidable noise pollution.

1.2.05-003.info:
Anyone who wants to overtake has to behave in such a way that there is no danger to the traffic behind his or her vehicle. When overtaking, sufficient lateral clearance must be maintained from other motorists, in particular from pedestrians and cyclists.

StVO §5.4:"When overtaking pedestrians, cyclists and drivers of very small electric vehicles with motor vehicles, the sufficient lateral distance is at least 1.5 m in towns  and at least 2 m outside towns."
1.2.05-003.text: When driving outside of a built-up area, you want to overtake cyclists or pedestrians. What is the minimum space to the side that you must maintain?

1.2.05-004.info:
Anyone who wants to overtake has to behave in such a way that there is no danger to the traffic behind his or her vehicle. When overtaking, sufficient lateral clearance must be maintained from other motorists, in particular from pedestrians and cyclists.

StVO §5.4:"When overtaking pedestrians, cyclists and drivers of very small electric vehicles with motor vehicles, the sufficient lateral distance is at least 1.5 m in towns  and at least 2 m outside towns."
1.2.05-004.text: Driving within a built-up area, you want to overtake a cyclist. What is the minimum space to the side that you must maintain?

1.2.05-005.info: StVO § 5.4:"When overtaking pedestrians, cyclists and drivers of very small electric vehicles with motor vehicles, the sufficient lateral distance is at least 1.5 m in towns and at least 2 m outside towns."

1.1.07-167.asw_2: - the safety devices, like emergency exits and emergency telephones are signposted
1.1.07-167.asw_3: - I can be distracted by lighting effects
1.1.07-167.info: In a tunnel, the sound generated by vehicles echoes, which can result in a loud and possibly disturbing background noise. Safety information must be observed in order to be able to react immediately in an emergency. While driving in Light effects, for example, through the tunnel lighting may have a distracting effect.

1.2.34-114.asw_2: A withdrawal of the driving licence or a driving ban
1.2.34-114.asw_3: An order to undergo a medical/psychological examination
1.2.34-114.info: Under § 142 of the Criminal Code (StGB), hit-and-run offenders are punishable by up to 3 years' imprisonment or a fine.A driving ban or a medical-psychological examination can also be ordered.

1.3.01-130-M.info: In this traffic circle the right of way is not regulated by a traffic sign, therefore the "right before left" rule applies.StVO § 8:(1) At intersections and junctions, whoever comes from the right has the right of way. This does not apply,1. if the right of way is specially regulated by traffic signs (signs 205, 206, 301, 306) or2. for vehicles coming from a field or forest path onto another road.(1a) If sign 215 (traffic circle) is placed below sign 205 (give way) at the entrance to a traffic circle, traffic on the circular roadway has the right of way. When entering such a traffic circle, the use of the direction indicator is not permitted.

1.4.41-020-M.asw_2: - use the restricted zone to make a turn

1.4.41-170.asw_3: I may not drive faster than 60 km/h
1.4.41-170.info: Anyone driving a vehicle may not drive slower than the specified minimum speed, unless road, traffic, visibility or weather conditions oblige him or her to do so. If you cannot meet the minimum speed you cannot use the road.

(3) Parking is not permitted1. in front of and behind intersections and junctions up to 5 m from the intersection of the roadway edges,

if a bicycle lane is built on the right side of the roadway in the direction of travel, in front of intersections and junctions up to 8 m from the intersection of the roadway edges,

1.1.06-131-M.asw_2: I move to the right, onto the parking strip

1.1.07-168-M.asw_3: I accelerate because I have priority
1.1.07-168-M.info: The blue vehicle parks out, apparently having overlooked me. To avoid an accident, I brake.As there is a motorcycle on the oncoming lane, I cannot swerve to the left."I accelerate because I have priority " would mean to accept an accident consciously only to be right. So wrong answer.

1.2.09-136-M.info: The pedestrian has "green", he will not wait.The bus will not leave immediately, some passengers are still boarding.The oncoming vehicle is just overtaking the bus and possibly the traffic light has been obscured by the bus. I must expect that the driver will not stop and go straight ahead.
1.2.09-136-M.text: What must you anticipate in this situation?

1.2.09-137-M.info: I just passed an electric scooter in the bike lane that is probably going straight. At the moment it is in the "blind spot".I have to stop because the electric scooter has priority.I don't have to stop because of the streetcar or because of pedestrians.
1.2.09-137-M.text: Why are you required to stop now?

1.2.11-006.info: If traffic is at a standstill, vehicles may not occupy the pedestrian crossing if they have to wait. If there is traffic congestion, you must not occupy the intersection or junction despite the right of way or green light signal if you have to wait.

1.2.12-132.info: StVO § 12 Stopping and parking(1) Stopping is not permitted5. in front of and in officially marked fire department access roads.Stopping may be permitted in one-way streets and no-parking zones.

1.2.34-007.asw_1: - deliver first aid to the injured
1.2.34-007.info: The first step is to secure the scene of the accident, then to provide first aid and then to alert the rescue service.

1.2.34-008.asw_1: Photographing the scene of the accident from a number of angles
1.2.34-008.asw_2: Exchanging the necessary details with those involved
1.2.34-008.asw_3: Describing the cause of the accident in the accident report
1.2.34-008.info: In the case of minor accidents without any doubt as to who is at fault, it is not necessary to call the police.You should always get the phone number, identity card number and insurance details. Photos of the accident situation and a description of how the accident occurred and the damage caused can also be helpful later when presenting the situation for settlement of the claim by the insurance company.

1.1.02-051-M.asw_2: I drive to the left past the person, leaving sufficient clearance space

1.1.02-136-M.asw_2: Because the bus is moving off
1.1.02-136-M.info:
Scheduled buses, trams and marked school buses stopping at bus stops may only be overtaken carefully, even if they are oncoming traffic.

A passenger who has left the bus appears to want to cross the roadway in front of the bus.
1.1.02-136-M.text: Why must you drive slowly now, and be ready to brake?

1.1.02-137-M.info: The speed must be reduced because a child behind the vehicle parked on the right threatens to run onto the road.
1.1.02-137-M.text: Why are you required to brake here?

1.1.06-005-M.asw_1: Because the cyclist could turn off to the left
1.1.06-005-M.asw_2: Because I am not able to see possible oncoming traffic in good enough time
1.1.06-005-M.asw_3: Because of the very poor condition of the left-side road surface
1.1.06-005-M.info: Although the cyclist does not give a hand signal, she could turn left to follow the other cyclist.Possible oncoming traffic cannot be detected in time by the parked cars, so I am not allowed to overtake here.
1.1.06-005-M.text: Why are you not allowed to overtake now?

1.1.07-025-M.asw_3: I manoeuvre over to the left side of the road
1.1.07-025-M.info: The behavior of the cyclist is not foreseeable. There is a risk that he will drive off, which would result in a collision.The oncoming vehicle prohibits a swerve to the left half of the lane.
1.1.07-025-M.text: What is the right course of action now?

1.1.07-169-M.asw_1: The driver of the yellow vehicle opens the driver-side door
1.1.07-169-M.asw_2: The blue truck pulls out to the left
1.1.07-169-M.asw_3: The cyclist pulls out to the left
1.1.07-169-M.info: All three answers are correct.The cyclist is very likely to swerve to the left and not stop behind the vehicle.The truck has just started and may be swerving to the left to make a turn.The vehicle has just stopped and the driver may be able to open the door.

1.1.07-170.asw_1: I continue to follow the traffic reports
1.1.07-170.asw_2: I take particular care when driving around bends and on the approach to summits
1.1.07-170.asw_3: I apply the emergency brake assist to safely stop before the tail end of the traffic jam
1.1.07-170.info: In the event of a possible traffic jam, it is important to drive with particular attention. Especially in curves and before crests, the end of the traffic jam must be expected at any time.It is also advisable to continue to follow the traffic reports.The emergency brake assistant cannot be used in a planned manner to stop safely. It intervenes automatically in a dangerous situation.
1.1.07-170.text: You are driving on a section of road where a traffic jam has been reported. What is the right course of action?

1.1.07-171.info: The cyclist coming from the left has the right of way. That's why I have to stop.
1.1.07-171.text: Why are you required to stop now?

1.1.07-172-M.asw_1: I perform an emergency braking manoeuvre
1.1.07-172-M.asw_2: I continue driving, ready to brake
1.1.07-172-M.info: There is a risk of collision with the cyclist coming from the left. He seems to be driving on despite the red traffic light, so that a collision can only be avoided by means of an emergency braking manoeuvre.
1.1.07-172-M.text: What is the correct course of action in this situation?

1.1.10-001.asw_3: I try to perform my trips around noon
1.1.10-001.info: Regular breaks and drink enough fluids is useful in high temperatures.At high noon, in the greatest heat to drive certainly not.
1.1.10-001.text: When ambient temperatures are high, this negatively affects driver concentration during long journeys and accident numbers rise. Which of the following is it advisable to do, so that you remain alert and can drive safely, even during high summer?

1.2.05-126-M.asw_2: I overtake the cyclist with a sufficient amount of side clearance
1.2.05-126-M.asw_3: I have to allow the pedestrian to cross the road
1.2.05-126-M.info: When overtaking in the inner city, you must maintain a lateral distance of at least 1.5 meters from cyclists.Since the continuous line may also not be partially crossed, overtaking the cyclist is not allowed.
1.2.05-126-M.text: What is the correct course of action in this situation?

1.2.07-105-M.asw_1: I move over to the right-hand lane after around 200 m
1.2.07-105-M.asw_2: I may overtake the vehicles driving in the right-hand lane
1.2.07-105-M.asw_3: I move into the right-hand lane now
1.2.07-105-M.info:
The left lane ends, two lanes merge. It is necessary to drive up to the narrowing of the lane and then merge into the right lane.

StVO § 7 Para. 4 states that the change to the continuous lane should only take place immediately before the narrowing. I may therefore overtake the vehicles in the right lane and do not yet change to the right lane.
1.2.07-105-M.text: What is the correct course of action in this situation?

1.2.09-138-M.asw_1: I allow the cyclist to pass through
1.2.09-138-M.asw_2: I glance over my right shoulder
1.2.09-138-M.asw_3: I take the turn ahead of the electric scooter
1.2.09-138-M.info: The StVO § 9 para. 3 clearly states here:"Anyone who wants to turn must let oncoming vehicles pass, rail vehicles, bicycles with auxiliary motors, bicycles and miniature electric vehicles even if they are traveling on or next to the roadway in the same direction."Therefore, I am not allowed to turn in front of the electric scooter and must let the cyclist pass.The shoulder view must be carried out, as I must make sure that no other road users are endangered.
1.2.09-138-M.text: What is the right course of action now?

1.2.20-108-M.asw_2: I drive with an increased level of alertness
1.2.20-108-M.asw_3: I slow down to walking speed now
1.2.20-108-M.info: Buses on regular routes, streetcars and marked school buses that stop at bus stops may only be passed with caution, even in oncoming traffic.My speed of 30 km/h is appropriate and does not need to be reduced.The bus does not have its hazard lights on, so I do not have to drive at walking speed.
1.2.20-108-M.text: What is the correct course of action in this situation?<pcaption>(Hazard lights are off)</pcaption>

1.2.26-010-M.asw_2: I reduce my speed and prepare to stop if necessary
1.2.26-010-M.asw_3: I continue driving at the same speed
1.2.26-010-M.info: The pedestrians appear to want to cross the street at the crosswalk and therefore have priority. By reducing my speed, I signal that the pedestrians can move onto the street.
1.2.26-010-M.text: What is the correct course of action in this situation?

1.2.34-009.asw_1: - leave my name and address at the scene of the accident
1.2.34-009.asw_2: - report the accident to the police
1.2.34-009.asw_3: - give my name and address to a witness not involved in the accident
1.2.34-009.info: It is necessary to wait a reasonable amount of time according to the circumstances and to leave one's name and address at the scene of the accident. In addition, the findings shall  abe made possible retrospectively without delay if one is entitled, excused or removed from the scene of the accident after the waiting period has expired. To this end, at least the entitled individuals or a nearby police station must be informed that they have been involved in the accident and given their address and the location of their vehicle. Additionally, the registration number and the location of the vehicle involved must be stated and the vehicle must be made available for immediate findings for a reasonable period of time.
1.2.34-009.text: Your vehicle has damaged someone else’s parked vehicle. Despite waiting a reasonable period of time, the owner of the damaged car fails to appear. What is the right course of action now?

1.2.36-015-M.info: When a police officer is directing traffic at an intersection, his instructions take precedence over all other rules, such as traffic lights and right-of-way signs.If the police officer holds both arms out to the side across the direction of travel, it means STOP. I must wait before the intersection.The motorcycle must wait because it wants to turn.The car coming from the left drives first.

1.3.01-040-M.asw_1: The green car may proceed ahead of the red car
1.3.01-040-M.asw_2: I may proceed ahead of the red car
1.3.01-040-M.asw_3: I may proceed ahead of the green car
1.3.01-040-M.info: The car coming from the left follows the course of the priority road and therefore has priority, it drives first.Both vehicles on the priority road have priority over me, so I drive last.
1.3.01-040-M.text: What is the right course of action here?

1.3.01-041-M.asw_1: I may proceed ahead of the red car
1.3.01-041-M.asw_2: The yellow car may proceed ahead of the red car
1.3.01-041-M.asw_3: I may proceed ahead of the yellow car
1.3.01-041-M.info: The vehicle coming from the right follows the course of the priority road and drives first.Since I am on the priority road, I drive in front of the vehicle coming from the left.
1.3.01-041-M.text: What is the right course of action here?

1.3.01-043-M.asw_1: The motorbike may proceed ahead of the yellow car
1.3.01-043-M.asw_2: I may proceed ahead of the yellow car
1.3.01-043-M.asw_3: I may proceed ahead of the motorbike
1.3.01-043-M.info: The oncoming vehicle follows the course of the turning priority road and drives first.According to the basic rule right before left, I may drive in front of the vehicle coming from the left.
1.3.01-043-M.text: What is the right course of action here?
